answers.author: Milton Agay
answers.text:
Cars parked all over yards; abandon junk cars in yards; trash all over; houses with no grass but dirt yards, houses in disrepair; single family homes turned into multifamily units against zoning ordinances.  This type of activity taxes neighborhoods that were designed with an infrastructure for single families.  The increase in the number of people living now in the neighborhood causes the roads to deteriorate faster, taxes water and sewer systems.  Look at the broken windows theory and look at developing a multi faceted response using police, fire for fire code violations, housing inspections and cite what would be the small violations to get a handle on things while working your way up to larger scale problems identified.  Use civil remedies to address many of the needs rather than looking at criminal violations. Please feel free to call for more details as the response can go on and on with suggestions.
